p: Various volatile compounds may serve as indicators of developmental maturity and as biochemical markers to evaluate seed quality. Several compound classes identified were alcohols, aldehydes, esters and lactones, ketones, and terpenoids. Many reports are available on the key volatiles of soybean [ 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]. The development of objectionable off-odor detection and classification methodology for use in grain grading has stimulated research on volatile components of soybeans and grains [ 9].
